Packaged milk, put up in half-pint containers, will soon go
on the market.
LERCH: Milk-drinkers in Tokyo will welcome the appearance of frosh milk
sold in paper cartons. In the near future the price, fixed by
government regulation, is 12 yen per carton, or about 4 cents.
Several commercial dairios are taking part in the experiment,
Tokyo is to be the first city offering inexpensive pure milk;
sold in this manner the idoa will bo followed later by other
cities.
ANNCR: Artificial Body Parts (ears, noses, arms and legs) are made
of resin by a Japanese Doctor.
LERCH: Professor Akiyama of the Japan Dental College has succeedod in
producing life-like body parts, with a new soft polyester resin.
